article.title: Lockheed to Upgrade Pakistan P-3 Aircraft
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Lockheed Martin Corporation, Owego, New York, is being awarded an $8,400,000 firm-fixed-price modification to a previously awarded indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity contract in support of the Pakistan Upgrade Program (PUP) for the P-3 aircraft. This effort includes Phase Depot Maintenance Phase I for aircraft 505; removal and replacement of engines for A/C 505 and 511; and support costs associated with a schedule extension to the PUP Plus effort. The Naval Air Warfare Center Aircraft Division, Lakehurst, New Jersey, is the contracting activity.
